author: {'steamid': '76561198021864291', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1658874462}
review:
StuntMANIA Reloaded ist ein Rennspiel mit einer sehr komischen (gleichzeitig komisch-komisch, aber auch lustig-komisch) Physik. Das Ziel ist in den größeren Leveln eine Reihe von Gegenständen einzusammeln und dabei möglichst viele Tricks hinzulegen.
Die Präsentation ist zwar recht billig, tatsächlich macht das Spiel aber ziemlichen Spaß und sorgt für einige Lacher (bei denen ich nicht weiß, ob diese beabsichtigt sind)

Für 5€ schon recht happig, aber im Sale kann man sich das mal für Zwischendurch ganz gut geben.

review: This game is perfectly in its scope- By that I mean you get what you paid for. It's a racing platformer with decent controls, a good amount of content to play through and unlock and it never feels like the devs put too much on their plate while working on the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199132455976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1676789429}
review: Simple, pas prise de tête, pas violent. idéal pour se détendre en faisant des figures et en essayant d'atteindre les zones difficiles. J'y jouais vers 2014 avec mon fils alors très jeune et il adorait. Je viens de le refaire (printemps 2022/Windows 2011/i5/vidéo AMD RX570, manette PS4) et c'est toujours aussi sympa, même si les graphismes ont un peu vieilli. Aucun bug rencontré, à part les rares fois où on il peut arriver de se coincer dans le décor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062562182', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1651903033}
review:
Petit jeu d'exploration en voiture télécommandée pour récupérer des pièces qui permettent de débloquer les voitures et niveaux suivants.
La conduite n'est pas très précise et la voiture a tendance à partir en tête à queue ou à prendre des courbes irrégulières qui gênent pour faire un bon saut. Bref c'est assez frustrant car on doit parfois s'y reprendre à plusieurs fois pour arriver à atteindre un endroit qui parait facilement accessible.
La caméra fixe n'aide pas non plus.
Et ma manette Logitech F310 n'est pas reconnue, c'est vraiment dommage.
Par contre le contrôleur Steam est reconnu.
Je ne recommande pas le jeu.
Il pourra plaire à ceux qui veulent juste tuer le temps car les différents modes de jeu sont là pour faire refaire chaque niveau plusieurs fois.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993304005', 'num_games_owned': 5486, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1650928864}
review:
A shallow and dull collectathon driving game that is devoid of content, faulty in handling, and totally uninteresting.

Positive:
- Driving apparently remote-control vehicles in open levels that involve platforming mechanics is promising, but unfortunately, there is little to do within the game worlds.
- Despite not having many options to choose from, the overall performance is good, staying at around 100 frames per second.

Neutral:
- Although the maps are somewhat sizeable, they are empty husks of what could potentially be a finished game. This ubiquitous barren vastness only exposes evidence of underdevelopment.
- Collecting coins and capsules around the maps is the game's main focus. One's coins collection is saved and maintained between runs, but the capsule counts are not.
- Game modes, maps, and vehicle skins are attainable by means of unlocks. This unexciting collectathon aspect may be appealing to some but annoying and unnecessary to others.
- Executing stunts and aerial acrobatics is neither fun nor fulfilling. Instead, these activities are ordinary and aimless.

Negative:
- The game launches in windowed mode and does not go past the initial splash screens. Pressing the Alt+Enter key combination will activate fullscreen mode, and fixes the situation going forward.
- While both keyboard and gamepad are allowed for input, only keyboard controls and keyboard settings are available to the player. The gamepad controls and settings are nowhere to be found.
- All three of the camera angles are nearly unusable. It is either too close, too restrictive of a forward view, or too overhead, in addition to being erratic and unpredictable in movements.
- Crashes are frequent and happen at random intervals during gameplay.
- All vehicles handle identically, with oversteer being a major issue for driving.
- Aside from unlocking more mediocre content, there is no other incentive to keep exploring plain and vacant locations. There is very little to do or to see, regardless of game mode or map.

Overall rating: 2.5/5.0

author: {'steamid': '76561198060372432', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1595467072}
review:
It's a damn shame that such a great game that existed in the unity web player games era is now forever lost to time through this poorly designed remake. Not only does the game not have any good things that you'd come to expect from a game developed at it's time, but it's performance makes the game literally unplayable. And when I say "unplayable", I mean, choppy performance on a GTX 1070 with an i7 8700k. Either that, or the game doesn't have support for 144hz which is also the case. 

Additionally, when I launched the game, it would cause my system to become very unresponsive for a good 30 seconds before I managed to be able to utilize any input to navigate to my task manager and close down whatever it was that was causing it........ which turned out to be the game itself, not surprisingly being a 32-bit application. It's not pretty. Couple all that with the fact that there don't appear to be any updates from the developers on if or when the game is being updated, and you can see why stuntmania online was the superior game back in the day.

*sigh*...

author: {'steamid': '76561198123526800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1704680463}
review: Bought this game for my 2 young sons who absolutely love it, I bought it 7 hours ago and they now have 5hrs logged.  Imagine if someone made an entire game based on the stunt track from Rush 2 extreme racing for N64.  There is a bug here and there, but nothing frequent or game breaking.  It is what's written on the wrapper, a wacky physics stunt racer game that just lets you screw around on various tracks, which is what I was looking for and just what I got.  Rush II/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014698888', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1574025533}
review:
This game plays as if it is incomplete. It:
- crashes on first launch
- has unbelievably terribly controls (seriously, your car will randomly veer off in a random direction with no input from you)
- launches you into the air on respawn
- is pixelated and grainy, even on highest graphics settings
- does not have an input control to actually use the power-ups you find around the map

The game itself is also just not fun. You start with one car on one level and have to drive around an "open world" type map picking up collectibles in order to unlock more maps and more vehicles. Considering how difficult driving actually is, this simply isn't worth doing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047455553', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1544299941}
review:
Este jogo lembra bastante os primeiros Tony Hawk Pro Skater misturado com Super Mario 64. Você deve passear pelos mapas coletando itens que liberarão os próximos mapas. O controle dos carros lembra o de carrinho de controle remoto, e é bem sensível. Acho os mapas meio difíceis e cansa depois de um tempo.

Se não fosse tão difícil encontrar todos os itens e não tivesse que pegar todos os power ups toda vez que começa o mapa, eu recomendaria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010560368', 'num_games_owned': 1183, 'num_reviews': 703, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1532634040}
review: StuntMANIA Reloaded представляет собой набор уровней с бонусами для исследования с помощью маленькой игрушечной машинке. Физика и оптимизация отвратительны, игра вылетает с частотой в 10 минут, машина после респавна может улететь навечно в космос (за границу уровня). Можно было бы закрыть глаза на эти проблемы ( что очень сложно), однако, сама по себе игра совсем не интересна, ехать на машинке и собирать бонусики на некрасивых уровнях - не самая веселая затея. StundMANIA Reloaded отправляется в корзину плохих игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095725964', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1498605967}
review: It's buggy as can be, but suprisingly fun. The game revolves around picking up powerups, coins and "battery" containers of three different colors. Coins are used to unlock new modes, vehicles and maps. Most levels are well designed, except for the sewer level which is by far the worst. It only takes about 5 hours to get all coins, but if you are going for all containers, I can see another couple of hours being added to the playtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1498546929}
review:
Tags: Driving & Racing
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: A hybrid between a driving game and a walking simulator. Collect easter eggs stuffed all over vaguely fantastical pre-rendered maps to unlock new tracks and maps and modes. Modes are simply the same stuff with more restricitons such as time limits

Outstanding Issues:
-Massive frames drop everytime an item is collected and particle effects explode
-Vehciles other than the default one can be difficult to control to the point of being unplayable
-Game has some rather stringent requirements to collect items that are scattered all over to make the barest of unlocks, 
-Some areas are not easily accessible, or even obviously part of the map. It is often necessary to pick up car improvements like a better jump to even progress past certain areas making the exploration more linear than it might look at first glance

Conclusion: I am not hostile to the idea of a laidback exploration styled game with remote controlled toy cars and nice environments while you do trick jumps and the like but between the design restrictions, grindy unlocks, frame rates problems and wonked out vehicle behavior of some unlocks and you are left with something that barely qualifies as a tech demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130516505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1496211117}
review:
StuntMANIA Reloaded is a freeroaming stunt based driving game where you objective is to perform stunts and pick up collectables.

Pros:
-Not challenging or demanding, offering grea playability as a time waster
-Pretty cheap for the type of game on offer

Cons:
-Controls are awfully sensitive and sometimes non-responsive
-Graphics feel otudated
-Becomes a bit repetitive after playing for a while

StuntMANIA Reloaded is great for younger kids, although I think older gamers can enjoy it if they don't expect too much.
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197966107556', 'num_games_owned': 1092, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1495989397}
review:
Black screen on the first run. Crashed in the first 20 minutes.

In this game you basically run around with an RC car, and collect things to unlock new levels, game modes, and cars.

Controls are quite glitchy and i have experienced a respawn bug where the car was sent hy in the air and crashed again to the ground. For a game where jumps are an important element the lack of a proper shadow make hard to negoziate landinfgs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963838914', 'num_games_owned': 1971, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1487094784}
review:
StuntMANIA Reloaded ist wirklich ganz nah dran, ein gutes Spiel zu sein, aber knapp daneben ist halt auch vorbei.

Die Steuerung ist übel, mit Controller geht's ein bissl besser, aber mit Tastatur ist es fast unspielbar. Die Spielphysik ist häfig seltsam - man überschlägt sich nicht zweimal, sondern zig mal... Die Grafik ist gar nicht so übel, aber warum die Render-Dreiecke der Umgebung meist größer als das Auto sind, weiß wohl nur der Designer. Es gibt kein wirkliches Spielziel, ausser das nächste Auto und die nächste Umgebung frei zu schalten, aber der Sammeleffekt greift nicht wirklich.

Ich glaube, dass das Spiel als Mehrspieler-Titel wirklich Spaß machen könnte, aber so reicht's halt in keiner Weise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989601107', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1482327619}
review:
StuntMANIA Reloaded was a game which I had conflicting thoughts on. It's fun and not serious or a pretentious game, and it feels like it was developed with attention and good intentions, however it has a few drawbacks which stopped it being as good as it could have been.

+ The design is mostly consistent throughout, nothing feels out of place 

+ Controls mostly work well

+ A throwback to games such as Re-volt, and more of a unique game today

+ The aesthetics, environment design and the car models are well designed and make the game quite visually appealing and colourful

+ The sound design is pretty good and the soundtrack is fun to listen to, nothing special or memorable but it works and it isn't particularly annoying or makes you want to turn the sound off. The engine noises sound like the cars actually have power behind them and each vehicle seems to have different sounds.


Negatives

- As other reviews stated, it's pretty glitchy. Most of these aren't game-breaking but some of them get pretty annoying, such as respawning in mid air and being thrown around or having small areas of ground which aren't solid.

- The car handling seems to be pretty strange, quite slippery until you collect power-ups, it seems to improve a little then but it's still quite odd.

- One level glitched and didn't have any sound playing, the sewer level glitched and some areas were without light, making it pitch black and impossible to see where you were.

-The collectables don't seem to have any purpose other than the coins, which could have been done better so that you had more of a reason to collect them. 

- You can't see how many collectables you've picked up until you collect another one, making it difficult to tell later on in the level if you've collected everything.

- The game doesn't end when you collect everything so you have to manually end the game which feels strange. There's no indicator of if you've played a level before besides having unlocked it.



That said, I bought this in a bundle for cheap and it ended up being one of the better games of the bundle, and it made up for the cost of the bundle by itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148722391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1488614369}
review:
when you first play it, it might seem a bit weird but the game really grows on you. It's a game that can be enjoyed by both young and old (some people say it's just for kids). there are a lot of different  modes, you have to explore each world, obtain coins, do stunts, use power ups. I throroughly enjoy this game and it keeps me coming back, it's also an ideal game for casual gamers because you can set out to do one or more things every time you play. 

i wrote this review mostly because the game got a lot of mixed reviews which i think is unfair because it's not a big game studio but they did deliver a really nice game

author: {'steamid': '76561198005271335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1474196034}
review:
[h1][b]TL;DR:[/b][/h1] Very bland and boring pseudo open-world stunt-racing game.

As much as I like play-testing other devs alpha-versions of their projects, asking people to pay money for it and not even calling the game "Early Access" is kind of hypocritical.

* [b]Controls are awful.[/b] Spins and twist are totally random -- you can be rolling down a perfectly flat hill and all of a sudden start twisting/spinning in the air.

* [b]No tutorial, no campaign, no storyline, no progression.[/b] Yes, you have cars, tracks and modes to unlock. Which is basically more of the same -- cars have all the same (awful) physics, and tracks aren't unique and seem like reskins. Modes are kinda unique, but boring nevertheless.

* [b]Game is riddled with bugs.[/b] Dying will usually bug up your sound (engine keeps revving), and respawning will occasionally launch you in the air -- you will be "falling" upwards instead of, like, you know, the gravity tells you.

* [b]Gameplay isn't obvious, to put it mildly.[/b] Pseudo open-world stunts racing game with no scores, no time limit, no opponents, no tutorial. Just roam around, pick some useless boosters (affects nothing), unlock new tracks, repeat the process there.

Extremely boring. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079504926', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1533962188}
review:
This game is fun, I will say. It's very unwinding and a relaxing game involving racing on amazing and awesome jumps and loops and well, stunts. STUNTMANIA Reloaded is a basic free-roaming racer involving several gigantic maps that have all sorts of hidden and secret areas to explore. Each of the ~10 maps feature hundreds of jumps and stunts, complete with large amounts of green, yellow, and red collectables to gather in each level. Also in each stage, there are 3 types of coins that need to be gathered in-order to unlock certain parts of the game. Some coins need to be gathered in 3 pieces, which will be spread around the map. These include the first coin, a "car coin", which is used to unlock different cars. Second, a "level coin", which is used to unlock different levels. And the only coin that comes in whole, the "gamemode coin", which is used to unlock gamemodes. Finally, in each level there will be a set of powerups. These powerups include Super Jump, Nitro, Antigravity, Teleport, and more. These little parts of gameplay make this game a very fun and relaxing racer/explorer, leaving you taking a long breath at the ramps, loops, and obstacles of each map.

"Wait, if this is 'very fun', then why did you rate it badly?" You may be asking.
The biggest and most dreaded downfall of all players' experiences is the giant number of glitches and bugs that there are in this game. Let me explain. So, you crash your car into a wall, and you wait around 2 seconds for it to respawn. Around 1/7 of the time your car will respawn being shot up into the air like a cannon and stay airborne for a good 40 seconds, leaving you with nothing to do but wait. Once that car comes crashing down again, unless you've picked up the "Mega Health" powerup, there's a 50/50 chance that you won't survive the fall, with the possibility of respawning shot up into the air once more. However, I have come to a slight realization of the glitch and it is if you've crashed with your car's nose tipped mildly upwards, it seems to bring up the glitch. An easy way to stabilize your car is holding down SPACE, but this is still unconfirmed as far as I know. In the game I guarantee that you'll find your car glitching through the map either fully, or just partially, even if you can make it out with a small hop. And, I've also taken note that you can literally drive up a flat wall, whether it be land, or a building, without any powerups or any help or tricks.

Now, I will say that this game is relaxing, fun, and enjoyable, but the glitches that this game possesses just seem to ruin the fun for most people. The price just doesn't seem like it's worth it's value if it's possessed by such bugs and broken mechanics, even if it's only $5. However, this game demonstrated to me amazing levels, and breathtaking and cool stunts and jumps and loops; This game is its own rollercoaster. But, even all of this doesn't top for the game's value. The only time I would recommend to buy this game is when it's on sale, or in Humble Bundle or other such sorts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992257920', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1648237955}
review: Picked this up in a bundle alongside a couple of games I actually wanted, and actually this is quite fun. If you ever played Re-Volt and liked finding the stars, this is basically that. Or, the parts of Carmageddon 2 where you were doing missions jumping from roof to roof. It's kind of almost like a car platform game. The controls (I used an Xbox 360 controller, which it does support, though doesn't actually tell you the button mapping or allow you to change it, but the default mapping makes sense to my hands) didn't quite feel right to start off with, but after a few minutes I got the hang of it and was able to control my stunt jumps quite nicely. It feels a little unfinished in places and I kind of wanted more than is available in terms of gameplay, but for a few quid, it's definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274020682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1601839444}
review: StuntMANIA Reloaded is a fun and charming do what you want, car game. Sure it's got some bugs, camera issues, respawning issues, textures not loading, but for $5 it really isn't a bad game. The music for the game is very interesting and is fun to listen to, and the ideas for the levels are really cool (Mini Golf is probably my favorite). There is a nice small selection of cars to choose from and having to collect coins to unlock them, levels, and game modes let's you search every nook and cranny on the map. Some pieces are difficult to find, but it shouldn't take long to get all the coins on every level. Go Crazy is a neat feature, no time pressure or objective really, you can go nuts and drive to your hearts desire, blowing up your car as many times as you want. One thing I really wish that would have been added were nice backdrops. It gets boring looking out into the gray/black outside of the arena, though this is a smaller issue. All in all, this is a good game for $5, even if it was $10. It's not the game of the year, but the developer clearly had a great idea in their head, and did a great job of making a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050135590', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1432198139}
review:
When title säys StuntMANIA my first thoughts are remake of good old classic: 4D Sports Driving aka Stunts.
Well this game certainly isn't one.
I's about open kind of world driving with RC cars. Your goal is to collect coins and other stuff from "track" to achieve new cars and tracks - if I figured it out. It could be fun BUT:
* The controls aren't rebindable and steering feels very clumsy.
* It doesn't work with my driving wheel (and hat HUGE con for driving game).
* It might have 360 controller support but not for PS controller, and well controls can't be rebind
* It's not pretty and I still have some performance issues. - well my computer isn't top of the notch, but so isn't this game.

Few pros:
* Open world. You really can't fail while driving. So it could be suitable for kids.
* Driving could be fun.
* This definitely isn't worst game in world. It actually could be good. - and some might feel like it already.

Got it from some bundle. Wouldn't buy it separately. And wouldn't buy bundle because it has this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093969418', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1618164144}
review: I haven't played much but this game is kind of fun for me. You basically just drive around doing lots of stunts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986922743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1429227300}
review:
Well what a surprise, this is actually a pretty neat little game. It has native Xbox 360 controller support, although there's nothing in the options or menus telling you what does what... it's not hard to figure out.

The controls feel a little touchy at first. Okay, a lot touchy. You have to make corrections quickly and there's not much margin for error, but you're controlling what's basically an R/C car that can take a lot of punishment, so it's okay.

The game starts out with nothing but an open world type map with all these powerups and collectibles scattered around everywhere. You have to build coins out of fragments to unlock more maps, vehicles, and game modes, but starting out you have access to 3-4 different vehicles so it's not bad. As you go through the level you also collect upgrades for your current car - things like nitro, super jump, low gravity, extra health, etc. The challenge is to figure out how to jump or climb up to the hard to reach spots to get your goodies. There's no penalty for dying, you just respawn at a random location, sometimes way up in the air.

Like other reviewers have mentioned, you have full control over your pitch and roll while in the air, so you're basically like a cat in that way. If you're good at being a cat, you'll always land on your feet... err... tires. If not, if you land on your nose or roof, you'll probably go boom if you're high enough.

You can switch camera angles. I found it's easiest to control spin from the bumper cam, but the disadvantage is it's harder to see where the roads, ramps, and hills lead off to. There's no way to adjust where you're looking, it's always straight ahead, except in third person, then the camera faces whatever direction you're going. There's a button to do a full 180 reverse, and another button to do a quick stop. It's not like a handbrake, it's to stop completely. This is useful for planting yourself on hard to reach ledges after you had to take a running jump to get to it. I keep forgetting that's what it's for but there it is.

So, this game is cheap, it's goofy, it's fun, and with so many things to unlock and maps to explore, I think it's well worth it for the price. Thumbs up! A solid 7/10 at least. Good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982971514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1429719300}
review:
First game to make me physically feel ill while playing. No, it's not an "insane" stunt game. It's just a poorly designed one. The physics are terrible, the smallest bump in the road will send you flying or 180ing. The controls suck, no matter how you tweak them and doing stunts, what few there are, is ridiculously easy. Now to the physically ill part; I can't really understand why this is literally the ONLY game to do it but I suspect it's because when you control the vehicle in 3rd person it appears the terrain, not the car, shifts. It looks ridiculous and it's a bit messed up. 

Even if I am the only that perceives the camera as such you're still left with a poorly made game that's too easy, despite itself, and not fun. There was definite potential here but it was wasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051713342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1428163717}
review:
The Short Version: 7/10, but keep in mind this is a driving exploration game, not a racing game. You'll be disappointed if you expect Mario Cart. Think Spyro's hub worlds in a car, and graphics like the original Spyro.

Long Version: I'm two levels in and I have to say this game is exactly what I wanted. You drive an RC car around a large area collecting hidden things and doing tricks. I have a couple of complaints, however. Doing tricks doesn't seem to do anything but flash some text; It'd be nice if there were more motivation for me to rack up score or soemthing. There doesn't seem to be a functional difference between the cars, and they all cost one coin to unlock (you get a coin by finding three parts in a level.) So after you've found one coin you'll unlock the car you like and after that there's no incentive to unlock more. The graphics are pretty rudimentary, and in places you'll think you're playing a PS1 game. 
Despite these issues, the game is still fun if you like exploring an area and collecting things in a vehicle. It brings back memories of playing Diddy Kong Racing and San Francisco Rush 2049's stunt mode, and is comparable to the drive-around-collect-stuff mode from Joyride Turbo on Xbox 360. I only wish this game's player investment system had gotten a bit more attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984681066', 'num_games_owned': 1209, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1428092310}
review: El coche es difícil de controlar. Es un poco mareante y la música repetitiva.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021258619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1428052066}
review:
This feels like the alpha version of a game. Within the only 5 minutes of playing the game, I encountered the following:

- The game didn't start on the first attempt - after the intro screen the window stayed black. Had to kill the process and restart.
- When starting out, there's only one game mode, one car, and one "track" available. You have to collect items on some sort of open-world island to unlock even other race modes. The open-world collect-things game mode was not fun to me, but of course that's completely subjective.
- The controls are laughably bad. A small change in slope may suddenly jerk the car around. You will do lots of flips and crashes for no reason. It's almost impossible to consistently go where you're aiming.
- The physics are hilarious or terrible, depending on your point of view. The car will do multiple flips in one jump all the time for no reason. At one point after my car exploded on impact, I respawned like 100 meters in mid-air. Instead of falling down, I "fell" up for probably 200 more meters before falling back down. I was in mid-air for at least 30 seconds total before hitting the ground and exploding again. This happened within the first and only 5 minutes of playing this.
- I gave up on the game after about 5 minutes. When quitting, the process crashed, got stuck and I had to kill it again via task manager.

I like small casual games, but this one is ridiculously unfinished. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074978490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1421797120}
review:
C'est un jeu de mini-voitures avec plusieurs vues possibles (changement de vue par TAB), le temps n'est pas limité dans les premiers modes (après il y a un mode avec un chronomètre  mais je ne l'ai pas testé).

Les points positifs sont :

. Jeu simple d'utilisation  (sauf pour sortir et valider les "coins", il faut faire "exit" => à savoir !!!)

. Jeu d'exploration : vous cherchez dans quel recoin est caché un bout de pièce, une pièce, ou un élément à trouver, ils sont assez bien cachés, il faut penser faire le tour de tout, penser que le mode téléporteur (trouver un cercle rouge de téléportation) peut vous aider à atteindre des endroits impossibles d'accès.          Penser à débloquer les bonus :  téléporteurs, nitro, miroir, etc.

. Jeu de style : Les figures faites avec des looping, etc. rapportent des bonus.

. Vous allez où vous voulez, ce n'est pas un circuit mais une MAP par circuit. Vous êtes libre même d'aller au delà de la map = reset de la position de la voiture + bonus !! Bonus également si vous atteignez des endroits durs à atteindre.

. Le temps imparti est infini, seul l'usure des chocs donnés à la voiture (ou au véhicule) peut la faire exploser (avec une barre d'alerte correspondante pour vous avertir), idem sous l'eau !

. Les "coins" gagnés sur une map permettent de débloquer  (1 coin entier = 1 déblocage de voir ci-dessous) : 
- des voitures ou véhicules (celle que vous voulez au choix) y'a un peu de tout !
- des maps (celle que vous voulez au choix)
- des modes (celui que vous voulez au choix)

Vous avez 3 coins, un de chaque type caché sur chaque map, en entier ou en morceaux à reconstituer, dès que vous les avez tous, vous pouvez ou continuer la map en exploration, ou sortir pour valider les acquis par "exit".


Les points négatifs actuels au 11/01/2014 sont :

. Quelques bugs ou oublis (coincage du véhicule dans le grillage .. mais le déblocage existe dans le menu, un message de bug en sortant du jeu, et la touche Q pour orienter la caméra qui sert à euh rien !? ... enfin chez moi ca ne marche pas).

. La musique (bon j'ai déjà fait pire personnellement je vous rassure, mais ca n'empêche pas que c'est dur à écouter 2 heures), surtout, en plus, sur un ordinateur !

. Pas de sauvegarde possible (la sauvegarde existe pour les "COIN" que vous avez trouvé et ce que vous avez débloqué avec, par contre c'est en automatique, à vérifier quand on relance le jeu, vu que chez moi il a planté à la sortie).

. Pas de mode multi joueur.


Dans l'ensemble c'est un très bon jeu, j'ai hate de le tester à la manette, en tout cas déjà au clavier, c'est très plaisant, et reposant, les fans de micro machines auront une bonne impression de jeu, je pense, même si les circuits sont libres ici.

Je le recommande donc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127083999', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1478125243}
review: O jogo é divertido, porém, a câmera parece estar embriagada e fica se movendo de um lado para o outro. Esse é o único ponto negativo que encontrei. Vale a pena adquirir na promoção com 75% de desconto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073622212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1440187957}
review: It's an okay game.  Graphics are nice.  Camera movement is awful though and makes me dizzy in about 2 minutes.  Good concept but I wouldn't tell my friends to go get it.  At least it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006369201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1421318426}
review: Very fun.  To a degree it reminds me of the original Carmageddon games where I would often ignore the race and just explore the levels.  This game has no race and gives you incentives for exploring.  It's a very relaxed and enjoyable kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047728393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1430, 'last_played': 1419386135}
review: this game is quite fun for all ages it's not hard to unlock everything in the game in 2 or 3 hours  I can see myself playing this game for over 200 hours. the things i really like are the fact you can control the car in the air and land anywhere you want by simply using nitro or steering it you can even climb up walls to get to where your going. landing every possible trick is done by learning how to control it in the air and i have almost mastered flight controls. this is one of those sleeper games where nobody pays attention to it but it's going to get super popular in time when friends see friends playing it for 200 hours or more like my friends will see. I recommend this game for everyone because in time i know the few minor bugs will be fixed and it will still be the perfect little game for everyone. Also it's that perfect little game to get all achievements in less than 15 hours. the hardest ones are the 25, 50 & 100x 1440 degree flatspins but they are easy to get with a little grinding. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cwY63uvTSE

author: {'steamid': '76561198077054156', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1504216758}
review: Really fun game for just messing about. it's got happy and bouncy music to go along with the cute visials. I've only 2 problems with the game, neither of which are serious. 1. camera can be a bit confusing, and 2. sometimes, in certan levels, when you respawn, you fly up into the air really high. I've only noticed it in junkyard and warehouse, but I've only unlocked these levels. Sitll good game & worth the 5 bucks.
